pass off.translation[0].definitions[0].d: if an event passes off well, badly etc, it happens in that way
pass off.translation[0].definitions[0].e: The visit passed off without any serious incidents.
pass off.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to make people think that someone or something is another thing
pass off.translation[0].definitions[1].e: They bought up pieces of old furniture and passed them off as valuable antiques.
He passed himself off as a doctor.
pass off.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to pretend that something is more valuable than it really is in order to deceive people
pass off.translation[1].definitions[0].e: The company had passed off brand-name drugs as its own.
